autumn.lang.internals

Class AbstractRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • autumn.lang.internals.AbstractRecord
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Copyable, Immutable, Mutable, Record, java.lang.Comparable<Record>, java.lang.Iterable

    public abstract class AbstractRecord
extends java.lang.Object
implements Record
    This class provides a partial implementation of the Record.

    A subclass must provide a single constructor. The constructor takes one parameter for each element in the record. The constructor simply copies its parameters into the appropriate elements. The new record must be immutable.

    A subclass needs to implement the following methods:

    • static method instance() - Returns an immutable empty instance.
    • static method create() - Returns a mutable empty instance.
    • bind(SpecialMethods)
    • bindings()
    • isStruct()
    • isTuple()
    • isMutable()
    • mutable()
    • immutable()
    • keys()
    • types()
    • values()
    • set(int, Object)
    • get(int)

    A subclass must provide bridge methods for every method herein that returns a Record. The return-type of the bridge method must be the subclass itself. For example in a subclass T, method copy() : Record should have a bridge method copy() : T.

    • bind(SpecialMethods)
    • set(int, Object)
    • copy()
    • immutable()
    • mutable()

      • copy

        public Record copy()
        This method creates a shallow copy of this record.

        If this record is mutable, then the copy will be mutable. If this record is immutable, then the copy will be immutable.

        Specified by:
        copy in interface Copyable
        Specified by:
        copy in interface Record
        Returns:
        a copy of this record.

      • compareTo

        public final int compareTo(Record other)
        This method compares this record to another given record.

        This method's behavior can be redefined using a special-method handler.

        By default, records are compared based on the natural ordering of their values(). If the other object is null, then this object is object is greater. If the other object is non-null, then the two records must have exactly the same keys().

        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Record
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Record>
        Parameters:
        other - is the other record itself.
        Returns:
        an integer indicating the relationship of this record to the other record.

      • equals

        public final boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        This method determines whether this record equals another object.

        Default Equality Rules:

        1. If other is null, then return false.
        2. If this is the same object as other, then return true.
        3. If other is not a Record, return false.
        4. If this.keys() is not equal to other.keys(), then return false.
        5. If this.values() is not equal to other.values(), then return false.
        6. Return true.

        This method's behavior can be redefined using a special-method handler.

        Specified by:
        equals in interface Record
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        other - is a value that may be equal to this object.
        Returns:
        true, iff this record equals the given value.

      • hashCode

        public final int hashCode()
        This method computes a hash-code for this record.

        This method's behavior can be redefined using a special-method handler.

        Specified by:
        hashCode in interface Record
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        keys().hashCode() xor values().hashCode(), by default

      • iterator

        public final java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Object> iterator()
        This method creates an iterator over the values in this record.

        This method's behavior can be redefined using a special-method handler.

        By, default this method simply creates an iterator over the values() in this record.

        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Record
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable
        Returns:
        an iterator over this object.

      • toString

        public final java.lang.String toString()
        This method creates a string representation of this object.

        This method's behavior can be redefined using a special-method handler.

        By default, a record's string representation is a parentheses enclosed list of its values().

        Specified by:
        toString in interface Record
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the generated string.
